quotes.quote: Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.
The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.

Being solitary is being alone well: being alone luxuriously immersed in doings of your own choice, aware of the fullness of your won presence rather than of the absence of others. Because solitude is an achievement.
The presence of passion within you is the greatest gift you can receive. Treat it as a miracle.
Forgiveness isn't just the absence of anger. I think it's also the presence of self-love, when you actually begin to value yourself.
Kids are born curious about the world. What adults primarily do in the presence of kids is unwittingly thwart the curiosity of children.
My presence speaks volumes before I say a word.
Solitude is strength; to depend on the presence of the crowd is weakness. The man who needs a mob to nerve him is much more alone than he imagines.
If I'm remembered for having done a few good things, and if my presence here has sparked some good energies, that's plenty.
Luck is not something you can mention in the presence of self-made men.
Happiness is rarely absent; it is we that know not of its presence.
A great leader also has the ability to make people an inch taller in his presence.
The best effort of a fine person is felt after we have left their presence.
Often the presence of mind and energy of a person remote from the spotlight decide the course of history for centuries to come.
We convince by our presence.
How empty is theory in the presence of fact!
Success often emerges in the presence of failure.
As men, we are all equal in the presence of death.
If your presence doesn't work, neither will your word.
Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies.
The presence of those seeking the truth is infinitely to be preferred to the presence of those who think they've found it.
I think all of us are always five years old in the presence and absence of our parents.
Like a missing tooth, sometimes an absence is more noticeable than a presence.
As we let our light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence actually liberates others.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. To keep our faces toward change and behave like free spirits in the presence of fate is strength undefeatable.
The presence of many does not and cannot replace the absence of one. That is love.
True peace is not merely the absence of tension: it is the presence of justice.
A friend is someone who protects you in your absence and appreciates you in your presence.
We must watch over our modesty in the presence of those who cannot understand its grounds.
The presence of even a single poor child on the street means a million defeats for mankind.
